data.text: @kchernecky With Coronavirus raging in many parts of the world and still dangerous here, I just can't imagine wanting to bring employees back to crowded business environments unless management wants to get rid of employees.  Seems that firing would be more humane.
@kchernecky I agree with you that they should. The problem is that most can't afford it. And with some companies it's the strikes you are out.
@LupusWarrior69 Sorry, no I wasn't disagreeing with you. Too bad the company doesn't have to pay the bill 🤬 or the people who came in knowing they were sick, spreading it to others
@LupusWarrior69 Ended up with a hospital visit. People need to stay home if they're sick 🤬
@kchernecky Do you disagree? Here's a thought for the company tho. If you are sick, work from home. ( Unless you are sick sick )
@DocGreeves When are these people going to understand micromanaging people is not leadership? https://t.co/O9B38kpBck
@kchernecky Management is very often Mismanagement.  Sigh.
